Art. 4.139. 
Protected adults 
Without prejudice to both article 4.138 and article 499/7, ¤ 4, of the former Civil Code, a person who, on the basis of article 492/1 of the former Civil Code, has been declared incapable of disposing of property, either by gift or by will, may nevertheless do so after having been authorised to do so, at his request, by the justice of the peace referred to in article 628, 3¡, of the Judicial Code.
The Justice of the Peace judges the capacity of the protected person to express his or her wishes.
Where, by virtue of paragraph 1, the Justice of the Peace gives the protected person authorisation to dispose of their estate by will, the protected person may only make a will in the form of an authentic instrument, without having to submit the draft to the Justice of the Peace.
By way of derogation from paragraph 3, the Justice of the Peace may authorise the will to be received in the international form where the formal requirements for a notarial will referred to in Article 4.183 cannot be fulfilled due to the physical incapacity of the protected person.
The Justice of the Peace may also refuse authorisation to dispose of a will by donation if the donation threatens the indigence of the protected person or his maintenance creditors.
